titleStmt.title: The characters of two royall masques The one of blacknesse, the other of beautie. personated by the most magnificent of queenes Anne Queene of great Britaine, &c. With her honorable ladyes, 1605. and 1608. at White-hall: and inuented by Ben: Ionson.
titleStmt.author: Jonson, Ben, 1573?-1637.

publicationStmt.publisher: [by G. Eld] for Thomas Thorp, and are to be sold [by L. Lisle] at the signe of the Tigers head in Paules Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Printer's and publisher's names and publication date from STC.
"The description of the masque" has divisional title page; register is continuous.
Running title reads: The Queenes masques.
"The description of the masque" identified as STC 14770 on UMI microfilm (reel 757, position 10).
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the signe of the Tigers head in Paules Church-yard
